page.title: 18Blaxton - buildings
page.content: Blaxton or Blakestone,is a small village on the borders of Yorkshire and Nottinghamshire,seven miles south-east of Doncaster.There is a Wesleyan chapel here which was built in 1834.The village also boasts a war memorial naming the men of Blaxton who died in the first and second world wars. Housing consists of old and new estates,the older estates mainly consisting of renovated privately- owned cottages.One such cottage (Barnside)was formerly a blacksmith's shop.There is a council estate and a modern private estate,the houses being mainly semi-detached. There are also some larger detached cottages(Rose Cottage,Beech Grove,White House).
